primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The reversal of fortunes between the 'lovers of money' and the 'social losers' through the lens of biblical tradition (Abraham/Moses).

tekstueel_bewijs: The parable is an invitation to the self-sufficient... to think again.
What do you think the rich man might have done differently?
It is, then, for us to act this out.
noticing the hunger and bodily sores of Lazarus
revising the abyss between haves and have-nots
They have the law and the prophets.
Moses is a summons to the rich man to get his ass in gear.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Poor/Lazarus (as beneficiary of the Subject's potential change)
tekstueel_bewijs: those who are disregarded by lovers of money
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly identified with the Subject (Rich Man) who must act.

tekstueel_bewijs: Parables are for thinking again and seeing differently.
we are children of this text.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the 'Reverser' of fortunes, but not the Helper for the Subject's task.

tegenstander.identificatie: Ideology of self-sufficiency and white privilege
tekstueel_bewijs: ideology or the propaganda or the advertising of consumer self-indulgence
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is a systemic and psychological blindness rather than a cosmic or ontological power.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's unconditional embrace of the poor (Lazarus).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God (via Abraham)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon bifurcates the gospel: Grace is for the 'loser' (Lazarus), but Law is for the 'hearer' (Rich Man). The programs do not intersect for the same person.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Parable → The Hearer ← Consumer Ideology

voorbeelden_god_subject: The LORD sets the prisoners free
God’s unconditional love is extended to the poor man
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The rich man... ate and dressed well
What do you think the rich man might have done differently?
We are not fooled by the ideology

voorbeelden: Moses is a summons to the rich man to get his ass in gear.
lovers of money... thought they could secure their own future
we can mostly manage and control the present

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes the hearer has the 'Savoir' (knowledge) and 'Pouvoir' (power) but lacks the 'Vouloir' (will) and 'Devoir' (sense of obligation).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S1 (for Lazarus) to S2 (for the hearer), arguing that S1 is unavailable to the rich man without S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Tension is maintained; the 'escape hatch' is rejected in favor of ethical urgency.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; S2 is presented as the only relevant word for the 'well-off'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon mentions grace, it structurally assigns grace only to the 'other' (the poor) while assigning the hearer a purely actantial role of 'Subject of Obedience'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: All the 'torment'... could have been avoided if the rich man had noticed...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: unconditional love is extended to the poor man who never met any conditions

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Rich Man is a negative exemplar; the hearer is warned not to repeat his failure to 'notice'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ as the one who crossed the chasm that we could not cross, enabling us to notice the neighbor.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Guilt and pressure to perform social justice to avoid 'ruin'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is bifurcated by class; the rich are saved by Moses (works/obedience).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon creates a sharp narrative divide between the 'Abraham-story' and the 'Moses-story'.
spanning_punten: Grace is for Lazarus, but only Law is for the hearer.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The story makes me wonder what the rich man should have done to make the story work differently.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The hearer is expected to 'think again' and 'act' based on their own cognitive shift.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'not noticing' or 'self-indulgence'—a failure of social ethics.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Call to Action' where the hearer is the Subject and God is the Judge/Sender of Law.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the primary actor of the 'active verbs' of change.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who notices the hearer in their 'poverty of soul'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'The rich man should have noticed', use 'Christ noticed us when we were the ones covered in the sores of greed'.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Show that the hearer is also spiritually 'Lazarus' at God's gate.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'Abrahamic embrace' provides the power to notice the neighbor.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'chasm' as something humans cannot cross by 'thinking again'.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To demonstrate the necessity of a Divine Subject.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Abraham's embrace of the hearer) → Ethics (The hearer's embrace of the neighbor).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and socially urgent, but it risks leaving the hearer under the weight of the Law without the enabling power of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a 'prophetic' call; semiotically, it is a 'legal' mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis focuses on the reversal; semiotics reveals that the hearer is excluded from the 'Grace' actant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the sermon creates two separate universes: one of grace for the poor and one of law for the hearer.

volledige_subject_lijst: We (are not fooled, act this out)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'grace' as a category for the character Lazarus, but 'law' as the functional engine for the audience.
